equipment: dumbbells: varying weigths according to streangth
trainerTips: Start with your hands by your waist with dumbbells in both hands.
Lift your arms to your shoulders, keeping your arms steady.
Let your arms go back to your waist.

equipment: dumbbells: varying weigths according to streangth
trainerTips: Start with your hands by your waist with dumbbells in both hands.
Lift your arms outwards till both are level with your shoulder.
Let your arms go back to your waist.

equipment: Barbell: varying weight according to your streangth
trainerTips: Rest barbell on shoulders behind head and stand up
with feet spread apart to shoulder distance.
Squat with good form down and slowly go back up to standing position.

equipment: dumbbells: varying weigths according to streangth
trainerTips: Hold Dumbbells in both hands and stand upright with your hands to your sides.
Move one leg one step forward and bend down till your knee is bent to 90 degrees.
Stand back up and move leg back underneath you. Repeat with next leg.
Lay on floor with tips of toes and both hands touching ground.
Push yourself up with your arms till arms are stright.
Slowly bring yourself back to starting position.
Lay on floor with tips of toes and both elbows touching ground.
Hold yourself straight for as long as you can.
Hang on bar with both hands and feet off of floor.
Pull your head above bar and slowly let yourself down.

equipment: Kettle bell: varying weight according to streangth
trainerTips: Spread legs to shoulder leangth apart and pick up kettle bell
between legs. Swing back a little and swing bell forward till
level with shoulders. Let it fall back and stop it between legs.

equipment: dumbbells: varying weigths according to streangth
trainerTips: Start in pushup position, but with dumbbells in hands against ground.
Pull one hand up to chest with dumbbell, then return to ground. Do next hand.
Hold hands at waist with a band in both hands. The other sides
of the bands should be on a foot. Extend hands in front of you
until level with shoulders. Slowly drop hands back to waist.
